channel.title: CVE Feed for livemesh -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for livemesh -- all products

item.title: CVE-2024-47303|2024-09-25T08:01:34.664Z -- livemesh -- livemesh%20addons%20for%20elementor
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation (XSS or 'Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in Livemesh Livemesh Addons for Elementor allows Stored XSS.This issue affects Livemesh Addons for Elementor: from n/a through 8.5.

item.title: CVE-2024-43320|2024-08-19T16:40:21.826Z -- livemesh -- livemesh%20addons%20for%20wpbakery%20page%20builder
item.description: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation (XSS or 'Cross-site Scripting') vulnerability in Livemesh Livemesh Addons for WPBakery Page Builder addons-for-visual-composer allows Stored XSS.This issue affects Livemesh Addons for WPBakery Page Builder: from n/a through 3.9.

item.title: CVE-2024-2655|2024-08-13T14:01:12.963Z -- livemesh -- elementor%20addons%20by%20livemesh
item.description: The Elementor Addons by Livemesh plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's Post widgets in all versions up to, and including, 8.3.5 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on author display names. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-37547|2024-08-02T03:57:39.619Z -- livemesh -- livemesh%20addons%20for%20elementor
item.description: Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal') vulnerability in Livemesh Livemesh Addons for Elementor.This issue affects Livemesh Addons for Elementor: from n/a through 8.4.0.

item.title: CVE-2024-3638|2024-08-01T20:20:00.333Z -- livemesh -- elementor%20addons%20by%20livemesh
item.description: The Elementor Addons by Livemesh plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's Marquee Text Widget, Testimonials Widget, and Testimonial Slider widgets in all versions up to, and including, 8.3.7 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-3639|2024-08-01T20:19:59.635Z -- livemesh -- elementor%20addons%20by%20livemesh
item.description: The Elementor Addons by Livemesh plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's Posts Grid widget in all versions up to, and including, 8.3.7 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-1466|2024-08-01T18:40:21.142Z -- livemesh -- elementor%20addons%20by%20livemesh
item.description: The Elementor Addons by Livemesh plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘slider_style’ attribute of the Posts Multislider widget in all versions up to, and including, 8.3.4 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page. CVE-2024-27986 may be a duplicate of this issue.

item.title: CVE-2024-1465|2024-08-01T18:40:21.249Z -- livemesh -- elementor%20addons%20by%20livemesh
item.description: The Elementor Addons by Livemesh plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘carousel_skin’ attribute of the Posts Carousel widget in all versions up to, and including, 8.3.4 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-1458|2024-08-01T18:40:21.195Z -- livemesh -- elementor%20addons%20by%20livemesh
item.description: The Elementor Addons by Livemesh plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘text_alignment’ attribute of the Animated Text widget in all versions up to, and including, 8.3.4 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.description: The Elementor Addons by Livemesh plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘style’ attribute of the Team Members widget in all versions up to, and including, 8.3.4 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.description: The Elementor Addons by Livemesh plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's Marquee Text Widget, Testimonials Widget, and Testimonial Slider widgets in all versions up to, and including, 8.3.7 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-2926|2024-07-04T03:32:24.045Z -- livemesh -- elementor%20addons%20by%20livemesh
item.description: The Elementor Addons by Livemesh plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the plugin's widgets in all versions up to, and including, 8.3.7 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-2385|2024-07-04T03:32:22.764Z -- livemesh -- elementor%20addons%20by%20livemesh
item.description: The Elementor Addons by Livemesh plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Local File Inclusion in all versions up to, and including, 8.3.7 via several of the plugin's widgets through the 'style' attribute. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to include and execute arbitrary files on the server, allowing the execution of any PHP code in those files. This can be used to bypass access controls, obtain sensitive data, or achieve code execution in cases where images and other “safe” file types can be uploaded and included.

item.title: CVE-2024-2539|2024-06-06T18:28:46.727Z -- livemesh -- elementor%20addons%20by%20livemesh
item.description: The Elementor Addons by Livemesh plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via widget '_id' attributes in all versions up to, and including, 8.3.6 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping on user supplied attributes. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that will execute whenever a user accesses an injected page.

item.title: CVE-2024-2385|2024-07-10T16:04:57.847Z -- livemesh -- elementor%20addons%20by%20livemesh
item.description: The Elementor Addons by Livemesh plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Local File Inclusion in all versions up to, and including, 8.3.7 via several of the plugin's widgets through the 'style' attribute. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with contributor-level access and above, to include and execute arbitrary files on the server, allowing the execution of any PHP code in those files. This can be used to bypass access controls, obtain sensitive data, or achieve code execution in cases where images and other “safe” file types can be uploaded and included.
